CatDescriptText: Mr. Sam Conner, student, Bethel and Mrs. Olive Johnston, housewife, near Coraopolis, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, August 26, 1961, pg. 1 with question: "Do you think there will be war over Berlin?"  Mr. Conner's answer reads: "I do believe we'll have one.  The way things are building up with this crisis, it's bound to happen."  Mrs. Johnston's answer reads: "Yes, because the plant where my husband works has been shut down for sometime, probably for conversion.  It struck me as funny that they were opening it up again.  They did the same sort of thing before, and it turned out that it was to convert to war production."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Sam Conner and woman wearing plaid shirt with tied shoulder straps, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Olive Johnston wearing plaid dress and eyeglasses, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
